org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter
Class BaseConverter<C,D>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter.BaseConverter<C,D>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Converter<C,D>, FormElementAware<C,D>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BigDecimalToDoubleConverter, BigDecimalToFloatConverter, BigIntegerToIntegerConverter, BigIntegerToLongConverter, BooleanToLongConverter, CompositeConverter, IdenticalConverter, ListConverter, ReverseConverter, StringToBigDecimalConverter, StringToBooleanConverter, StringToCharacterConverter, StringToDisplayItemConverter, StringToIntegerConverter, StringToLongConverter, StringToNumberConverter, TimestampToDateConverter
public abstract class BaseConverter<C,D>
extends Object
implements Serializable, Converter<C,D>

This class is the base class for form converters. The converters' task is to convert the value of form Control to the value of FormElement Data and back.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

convert

public D convert(C data)
This method converts the data from one type to another. If the data is null then null is returned. Otherwise convertNotNull(Object)method is used for actual conversion.

Specified by:
convert in interface Converter<C,D>
Parameters:
data - Data to convert.
Returns:
Converted data.

reverseConvert

public C reverseConvert(D data)
This method converts the data from one type to another (though the types are exchanged in comparison with convert(Object)). If the data is null then null is returned. Otherwise reverseConvertNotNull(Object)method is used for actual conversion.

Specified by:
reverseConvert in interface Converter<C,D>
Parameters:
data - Data to convert.
Returns:
Converted data.

addErrorWithLabel

protected void addErrorWithLabel(String error)
Since mostly the parameter to the error message is the name of the input field, this method automatically adds the resolved input field name to the given error message.

Parameters:
error - The error message that takes the input field name as its parameter.
Since:
2.0

newConverter

public abstract Converter<C,D> newConverter()
This method should return a new converter, of the same type that the class that overrides it, however freshly initialized.

Specified by:
newConverter in interface Converter<C,D>
Returns:
a new converter, of the same type that the class that overrides it, however freshly initialized.

convertNotNull

protected abstract D convertNotNull(C data)
This method should convert the data from one type to another. It may assume that the data is never null.

Parameters:
data - Data to convert.
Returns:
Converted data.

reverseConvertNotNull

protected abstract C reverseConvertNotNull(D data)
This method should convert the data from one type to another. It may assume that the data is never null. The types of data are reversed in comparison to convertNotNull(Object).

Parameters:
data - Data to convert.
Returns:
Converted data.
